I bought Half-Life OG because:
1. No matter how many remakes or engine updates it gets, this is how the original fans experienced it for the first time.
2. I have never played the original. I've only ever played Half-Life 2 and it's respective (sequels/expansions/addons/dlc/part of Half-Life 3/Half-Life 4 beta)

I beat Half-Life in a night, within in roughly 6 hours. Here is my Stance:

As an already late fan into the series with Half-Life 2, it of course is odd to backtrack 6 years in engines and graphics. Although I like good games, so this did not bother me. TL:DR, the game is incredible. For a game almost 20 years old, it truly stands the test of time. 

It does have some faults that can be easily overlooked. First being is being an old FPS, it's difficult even on "Normal" difficulty. I found about 2 bugs in the game. 1 being where I would be stuck in place and "noclip" wouldn't even work. So I would have to reload my save, this happened twice. But if you're a longtime pc FPS player, you shouldn't have problems doing that if you quicksave like a fat kid on cake. And the other being right before you *SPOILER* encounter covert ops, the game would crash, this was just trial and error, again twice, by just reloading. 

The game is a masterpiece, buy it for sure as this summer sale is going on. Buy it if the summer sale isn't. It's truly a piece of history and art that should be experienced.

Without any doubt in my mind, I can recommend this game to anyone.
It is simply amazing. A masterpiece in all regards.

[h1] Прошел впервые 2015, поиграл в 2019, тащит до сих пор.[/h1]

Игра мне очень понравилась, да сейчас графика смотрится так себе, но это не главное. Не главное от слова совсем. В этой игре Valve заложили механики, которые используются до сих пор. Все вымерено насколько тонко и идеально,что прям хорошо. 

Сюжет
Да он есть, и самое прекрасное, что вы и есть сюжет. Тут нет киношных вставок (кроме одной), все остальное вы сами путешествуете и воссоздаете сюжет.  Если коротко, мы играем за молчаливого физика Гордона Фримана, который на научной станции Черная Меза участвует в эксперименте, как вы понимаете неудачно. Потусторонний мир прорывается к нам, и тут начинается экшен.

Графика
Даже сейчас, не смотря на угловатость, несмотря на старую морально графику, в игре можно провести и залипнуть не один вечер и перепройти её пару тройку раз. Она обладает атмосферой и это круто.

Геймплей
Не так уж прост, тут есть интересные механики. Но по сути это шутер, но эталонный.

Звук
Мне везде понравился. Жаль я не помню музыки.

Итог
Игра, которая прошла проверку временем. Для меня однозначно шедевр, и рекомендован к покупке и ознакомлению.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=879236373

Pure Nostaglia!

This game started it all. From the "Hail Lord Gaben" to "Half Life 3 confirmed?" to the memes about "what would happen if Gordon Freeman would've talked" to the countless fan-made movies, mods, art and so much more! This game put Valve on the map with a big star.

You are scientist Gordon Freeman, working at the Black Mesa Research Facility (In our world consider it to be the science-fiction version of Area-51) where you are caught in a freaky lab accident that pratically descended the entire facility into not only a hell-hole but also a warzone. Work your way through the facility with the help of your fellow personal as you fight off these alien creatures from the borderworld of Xen, and also the Military Clean Up crew.

The only slight errors this time around are, once again the mouse senstivity (adjust that to 1.0) and the Gamma (send that dial on to low) also note apply these to Blue Shift and Opposing Force (If you think it's best, however).

the Mulitplayer servers are still active although it might be hard to get into some of them. But it shouldn't be a big deal.

Other than that. If you want to play the game that started it all. Get. This. Game. I highly recommend it!

I heard of this game far and wide. Great gameplay, they said. Gripping story, they said. A truly outstanding masterpiece of a game. Finally, during the early days of the 2015 summer sale, I bought the entire series. Then, to my dismay, the game gave me a black screen. "Surely," I thought, "this must just be loading. After all, my laptop isn't that powerful." But the minutes ticked away, and eventually I hit ctrl+alt+del to see if it was working. Alas, "HL is not responding." I closed the program. "A bit of bad luck," I assured myself. "THIS time, it will work." Despite my hopes, I was again confronted with a black screen, and again I was forced to manually close it. Again and again, I tried to open this game, and each time I failed. I could not believe that the centerpiece of my favorite game company could not even properly load itself. Yet here I am, warning all of you to stay away from Valve's greatest sham.

Half Life is by far one of the best FPS games I've played. I played the original half life before half life 2 came out(obviously), and it blows a lot of FPS games I've played from that era out of the water. That said however, there is some minor technical problems with how the collision algoritm was written.. sometimes you'd fall through floors or cracks in the walls requiring you to reload an older save point from before. There is also some bugs with the AI I've noticed, sometimes when you have to get it to follow you, I've had the characters disappear, get stuck in walls, or just randomly start walking in circles. I've experienced this with HL1, HL1:BlueShift, HL1:OpposingForce.

The game is old(Pushing 16 years now) but brings a lot of memories back from that era of gaming. Definitely something you should pick up and play, even when it's not on sale!

Silent Scientist Simulator (say that 10 times fast)
A Public Service Announcement: 
This game is best experienced if you:
-Are able to think logically and analyze situations and locations on the fly.
-Can figure out other ways to defeat challenging enemies other then mindlessly shooting bullets everywhere.
-Have good problem solving skills and a high patience level.
-Are able to figure out how to crouch-jump
-SAVE YOUR GAME FREQUENTLY! 90'S games are not known for having frequent autosaves, and this one is no exception.
-Figure out that your grenades will probably not go as far as you want them to!
This game is not recommended if your version of a higher-level thinking game is COD or even Halo, but especially COD.
This game has ruined me and made all other games insignificant by comparison.
This game just proves that older games such as this one and Halo: Combat Evolved were held to a much higher standard than games nowadays.

It doesn't get any more classic than Half-Life. The game where Mr. Gordon Freeman and Black Mesa made their debut, it's action-packed to the brim. The game doesn't have markers telling you where to go, so you might stumble upon to something you weren't supposed to find until way later. This game is timeless with a capital T. Of course the graphics are dull, but it was made in the '90's. Just remember to not get your brains eaten by what Barney Calhoun calls "Head Humpers."

A masterpiece of gaming. It aged well, it is very fun and it is a classic. Everybody should play this game. It is not perfect but it is dangerously close of being.

Half-life is regarded as one of the greatest games of all time.

The story is you are Gordon freeman, who is a character with zero personality at all with a bad case of silent protagonist, and you’re on your way to work at the black mesa facility. Not long after you cause a disaster unleashing aliens inside the base going around killing everyone and the military is sent in to “clean things up”. The story is nothing special and a lot is left in the dark since you don’t really know all that much in the game, but what was special for the time was how it was told, since you never leave Gordon’s perspective. 

The gameplay is a mix between solving puzzles, exploration and the standard late 90s shooter gameplay. This game also added a bit of realism to shooters compared to the previous games of the 90s, no more floating guns, a more realistic progression rather than level by level and hunting for keys to open doors. The gameplay also shifts and changes throughout the game, at the beginning you only have a crowbar and a handgun and you’ll mostly be fighting monsters in a horror-ish style, later you get your hands on more weapons being; a shotgun, a machinegun, a magnum and some grenades as the game becomes more action oriented as the soldiers show up, and the game changes again as the alien soldiers show up and you get your hands on more weapons; a rocket launcher, and some original weapons in the game (being energy weapons)  it changes yet again as you go onto the alien planet. The game also changes pace quite a fair bit since the game will sometimes throw a platforming section or a puzzle at you after gunfights. 

Though being a so called great game of all time Half-life does have a number of issues: 

The melee combat: all gold source engine games have terrible melee combat since you have to be so close to hit anything but this is a shooter so this isn’t a big deal unlike some other gold source engine games. 

The shooting isn't very good since enemies don't react to getting shot at all, so there's no stunning them when shooting at them, and you can also peek around coners so you can see the enemy's hands, and then just shoot their hands until they die, which is pretty stupid and just cheating. To me this is kind of weird, since the gold source engine is basically the quake 1 engine, and in quake 1, all of the enemies get stunned when shot apart from the wampa/yeti things which are meant to be bullet sponges.

Also the fall damage is very over exaggerated and this is really annoying during some of the platforming sections, and the ladders, the ladders in this game are very clunky, because you feel like a magnet stuck to them and you usually detach from them and fall right down to the bottom. 

The game does also get boring for two reasons: 

Reason no1: there is no music for the most part which was to add to the emersion, however it does get boring after while listening to nothing but your own footsteps. 

Reason no2: Some of the sections in this game drag on, and on, and on.

There are also some game breaking bugs, thank god for the existance of NOCLIP.

At the time this was groundbreaking but today it's an ok game but it just hasn't aged very well, to the point where I sometimes call it half-S H I T E. Still better than half life 2 though.

Juegazo, una historia muy tocha y muy malos graficos respecto a estos años en los que ya utilizamos el 4K.

La historia, al principio parece un simple juego de matar zombies y demas bichos mientras escapas de unos laboratorios, pero poco a poco la historia va cambiando, los colores rojos de los juegos de matar bichos van acambiando a tonos negros de los juegos de misterio e intriga.
Los graficos, sinceramente, en la epoca en la que vivimos, estos graficos dan dolor de cabeza, pero si nos paramos a pensar, en el 1998 que en mi caso tenia 2 añitos, ¿que graficos habian? comenzaban los juegos de ordenador, la calidad 114p no estaba mal para esa epoca, cierto es que se remasterizo digitalmente, pero ¿quedó como debia? la verdad es que hay un salto importante de la calidad del Half-Life al Half-Life Source, son 6 años de diferencia. Pero, ¿mejoró lo suficiente? estamos en la misma situacion, para la epoca claro que si, pero para hoy en dia, es la tipica calidad cuando no te quedan megas en el movil y ves videos por internet. Pero nace en el mismo año de la remasterizacion la secuela de este juego, secuala que se ve diferente resecto a la edicion remasterizada, se ve que el remasterizado fue un claro ejemplo de Hipe de Valve, como actualmente con el HL3.
Sinceramente, creo que antes de sacar el HL3 deberian remasterizar ambos juegos, no subir un update y ya está, que se mojen un poco las manos y le den a estos juegos con historia y de la historia una capa de maquillaje para aguantar mas años.

[b]For those of you who have not played Half-Life[/b]
If you're like me you've heard a lot of things about this game. Primarily, how great it is and how the community has been waiting over a decade for the third instalment. Both are very true. After playing through the series I have this to say: if you are willing to join the rest of us in this agonizing wait, play this game. If not, know that it is worth all the hype and leave it alone. I have no regrets.
This game has held up well, good puzzles and will make you think. unlike most classic games, his one is timeless.
